info.name: Firefox Tab-Close Button Bookmarks Cursor Pointer
info.description: This style closes tabs with a hand pointer, pointing finger, instead of the default arrow pointer. A pointing finger icon, for links, seems best for tab-close buttons. I also applied the hand pointer to bookmarks toolbar, and personal-bookmarks, which considering they're actually links it seems correct. "Help cursor" is implemented in bookmarks menu. Hand pointer makes it easier to close tabs. Closing is more focused-precise. You can easily change my cursors-pointers to any type you desire via the helpful resource list in the code. You may be interested to note I use Tab Mix Plus and Classic Theme Restorer for other styling issues, but those addons aren't needed to make this pointer-style work.

style.css:

Singularity Utopia Style
@2045singularity

.tab-close-button

{
    cursor: pointer !important;
}

tab

{
    cursor: default;
}

#personal-bookmarks 

{
    cursor: pointer;
}

#bookmarksMenu

{
    cursor: help;
}
